newsitem.title: UK: Abbey extends drop as Laing cuts to "hold".
newsitem.headline: Abbey extends drop as Laing cuts to "hold".

text.p: Shares in Abbey National fell on Thursday, extending yesterday's decline, after brokerage Credit Lyonnais Laing cut its rating to hold from buy, dealers said.
By 0923 GMT, the shares were down 17p to 779. The rest of the sector, which has been outperforming the broad market, was mixed.
They reached a record peak at 812p on Wednesday before retreating as a Lehman Brothers analyst cut the stock to "underperform" from "neutral."
Credit Lyonnais Laing bank analyst Martin Hughes said he did not downgrade his earnings estimates for the Abbey.
"The shares are up about 40 percent since we suggested buying them. We just cut it back to a hold," he said.
